title: Was Jesus alive at the same time that Socrates was? - Quora

response.answer_text: You mean like having human DNA and eating, sleeping, pissing, stuff like that? Yep. Anybody who tells you different is lying to you. Addendum I'm sorry I did not read the question carefully. I thought it said “Was Jesus alive like Socrates was alive?” The answer to THIS QUESTION. Is no, missed by 400 years. Socrates died 399 BCE. Jesus was born in 6 BCE or 6 CE depending on whether you believe Matthew or Luke. He died on the cross sometime around 28–30 CE. Then he rose from the dead, but not in a mortal body. That's another discussion.

I really like Ian Sawyer’s answer for this question: “Socrates was born in either 469 or 470 BCE and died in 399 BCE, whereas the biblical Jesus is supposed to have been born around 4 or 5 BCE and died somewhere around 30 CE.” I would only extend it with a question: How do you define being alive? Christians believe that Jesus Christ is the son of the Almighty God who lives forever. So from this point of view he was alive and he is still alive, just not in a human form, he is in the Heaven. If we only see being alive as being alive in a “normal” human body he “was only alive” from his birth until the crucifixion. After the resurrection he had a special form, which is a different story.
